content.title: Inflation and the Planck Scale: Quantum Origins of Cosmic Structure
content.abstract: Cosmic inflation connects Planck-scale quantum fluctuations to the largest structures in the universe. During inflation, quantum fluctuations at nearly Planck-scale energies were stretched to macroscopic size, seeding the cosmic microwave background and galaxy formation—making the CMB our best window into physics near the Planck scale.

statement.text: Cosmic inflation stretches quantum fluctuations from sub-Planckian scales to cosmological scales. The energy scale during inflation H_inf ~ 10¹³-10¹⁴ GeV is only 10⁵-10⁶ below the Planck scale E_P ~ 10¹⁹ GeV. The observed CMB anisotropies (δT/T ~ 10⁻⁵) directly trace back to quantum fluctuations during inflation, providing our closest observational probe of Planck-scale physics.
statement.observable: CMB temperature fluctuations δT/T ~ 10⁻⁵ encode inflationary quantum fluctuations

explanation.intuition: Imagine the early universe: a hot, dense soup rapidly expanding. During a brief period called inflation (lasting ~10⁻³⁶ seconds), space expanded by a factor of at least 10²⁶. Quantum fluctuations—the irreducible jitter of quantum mechanics—got stretched like the pattern on a balloon being inflated. These tiny fluctuations (~10⁻³⁵ m initially) became the seeds for all cosmic structure: galaxies, stars, and us. The CMB's temperature variations are the fossilized imprint of these stretched quantum fluctuations.
explanation.key_insight: Inflation is the only known mechanism that connects quantum mechanics directly to cosmological observables. The scalar power spectrum P_s ∝ (H_inf/m_P)² means the amplitude of fluctuations depends on the ratio of inflationary Hubble parameter to Planck mass. This ratio is observable! We measure δT/T ~ 10⁻⁵, implying H_inf/m_P ~ 10⁻⁵, so inflation occurred at energy scale ~10¹³-10¹⁴ GeV—only 5-6 orders of magnitude below Planck scale.
explanation.technical_details: Inflationary quantum fluctuations: Mode equation ü_k + (k² - ä/a)u_k = 0 in conformal time. Bunch-Davies vacuum gives u_k = (1/√2k)e^(-ikτ)(1 - i/kτ). Power spectrum: P_ζ(k) = (H_inf²/8π²m_P²ε)|_{k=aH} where ε = -Ḣ/H² is slow-roll parameter. COBE normalization: A_s = P_ζ(k₀) = 2.1 × 10⁻⁹ at k₀ = 0.05 Mpc⁻¹. This gives H_inf ~ 10¹³ GeV for ε ~ 0.01. Tensor-to-scalar ratio r = 16ε probes H_inf directly: r = (P_t/P_s) = 16ε gives H_inf² = (π²/2) × r × A_s × m_P². Current bound r < 0.036 (BICEP/Keck 2021) implies H_inf < 6 × 10¹³ GeV. Trans-Planckian problem: Modes observed today had wavelength λ < ℓ_P at start of inflation! This challenges our use of standard QFT, potentially probing Planck physics.
common_misconceptions: WRONG: 'Inflation proves quantum mechanics is cosmological' — It's evidence, not proof; alternatives exist
WRONG: 'CMB directly shows Planck scale physics' — It probes 10¹³ GeV, not 10¹⁹ GeV directly
WRONG: 'We understand trans-Planckian modes' — This remains an open theoretical question
WRONG: 'Inflation is proven' — It's the leading paradigm with strong evidence, but alternatives exist
CORRECT: 'Inflation is our best probe near Planck scale' — CMB observables trace to 10⁻⁵ × m_P

slow_roll_parameters.role: Control duration and dynamics of inflation

primordial_power_spectrum.origin: Quantum fluctuations of inflaton (scalar) and metric (tensor)

trans_planckian_problem.statement: Modes observed today had λ < ℓ_P at start of long inflation
trans_planckian_problem.implication: Initial conditions may depend on Planck-scale physics

physical_predictions.status: Confirmed! Spectrum is nearly but not exactly scale-invariant

physical_predictions.description: Quantum origin implies nearly Gaussian statistics

physical_predictions.significance: Detection would directly probe inflation energy scale

physical_predictions.description: Correlations on scales larger than horizon at recombination
physical_predictions.observable: Acoustic peaks in CMB; anti-correlation at ℓ ~ 150

energy_proximity.significance: Closer to Planck than any laboratory experiment

trans_planckian_modes.issue: Observed modes had λ < ℓ_P early in inflation
trans_planckian_modes.implication: CMB may encode Planck-scale initial conditions

possible_signatures: Oscillations in power spectrum from modified dispersion
Running of spectral index from RG flow
quantum_gravity_effects.current_constraints: No detection; consistent with standard slow-roll

cmb_as_planck_probe.statement: CMB is our most sensitive probe of near-Planck physics
cmb_as_planck_probe.future: CMB-S4, LiteBIRD may probe r ~ 10⁻³, approaching GUT/Planck scales

open_questions: What is the inflaton field? Is it a fundamental scalar?
How does inflation connect to Planck-scale physics?
What set the initial conditions for inflation?
Why did inflation start? (Initial conditions problem)
Can we ever directly probe Planck-scale effects in CMB?
Does trans-Planckian censorship protect classical predictions?

definitions_glossary.cosmic_inflation: Period of exponential expansion in early universe driven by vacuum energy
definitions_glossary.hubble_parameter: H = ȧ/a, expansion rate of universe; during inflation H ≈ constant
definitions_glossary.inflaton: Scalar field driving inflation; its potential energy dominates
definitions_glossary.primordial_power_spectrum: Statistical properties of initial fluctuations: P(k) vs k
definitions_glossary.tensor_to_scalar_ratio: r = P_t/P_s, ratio of gravitational wave to density fluctuation amplitudes
definitions_glossary.spectral_index: n_s, power-law slope of scalar spectrum; n_s = 1 is scale-invariant
definitions_glossary.trans_planckian: Referring to wavelengths or energies beyond Planck scale
